summary: Update the existing multi-page portfolio website for Sheik Tonmoy Islam so the visual theme is fully replaced with a full-page, static (generated) waterfall picture background applied across every page; then rebuild and redeploy under the existing domain identifier "sheik-tonmoy-islam".
architectural_notes: Implement as a multi-page site with separate routes/pages for Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio/Projects, Contact.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive multi-page portfolio website with separate pages for Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio/Projects, and Contact, including a persistent top navigation and footer.

Apply a coherent, unique blue-gradient visual theme across the entire site (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) while keeping the design professional and suitable for a lawyer/business profile.

Add the two uploaded images ("Tonmoy islam pic.png" and "Tonmoy islam pic-1.png") to the frontend as static assets and display a profile photo prominently on the Home page hero section (with a clean portrait frame).

Implement the Home page hero content using the provided name "Sheik Tonmoy Islam" and include a short professional intro summarizing the roles: internship junior lawyer, business man, digital marketer, graphics designer, video editor, and website designer.
Build an About page that presents a professional biography and highlights the user's multi-disciplinary background in law, business, and digital services.

Build a Services page listing offerings relevant to the user's roles (legal internship support, business services, digital marketing, graphics design, video editing, and website design), with clear service cards and short descriptions.
Build a Skills page with categorized skills and visual indicators (e.g., tags, progress bars, or meters) aligned to the listed disciplines (law/business + marketing/design/video/web).
Build a Portfolio/Projects page with a grid of project cards (title, short description, stack/tools, and optional links) and include filtering or categorization if feasible without extra user input.

Create a Contact page with a contact form (name, email, subject, message) and persist submissions to the Motoko backend (no external email/SMS integrations). Provide a success/failure UI state after submit.
Add basic SEO-friendly metadata (title, description, Open Graph tags) per page and ensure the site is indexable (no noindex).
Generate and include required static design assets (logo and abstract gradient background) in the frontend and use them consistently in the UI.

Add a small version of the uploaded photo "Tonmoy islam pic.png" inside each page section layout (About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Contact) positioned at the top-right corner of the section content (i.e., within the page’s main Container), not as a fixed global element.

On the Home page, keep the existing large hero portrait as-is, and additionally place a smaller "Tonmoy islam pic.png" portrait in the top-right corner of the Home page’s section content to match the pattern used on the other pages.

Update the Contact page to display the user’s direct contact details, replacing placeholder text. Show email as "gamil-official.tonmoyislam@gmail.com" and WhatsApp as "01999785559" with clickable links (mailto for email; WhatsApp deep link for WhatsApp).

Publish/deploy the updated website and provide a shareable live link. If publishing is blocked by domain validation rules, choose a valid domain/identifier that meets the constraints (5–50 characters; only letters, numbers, and hyphens) and complete the publish step using that valid identifier.

Add the uploaded image "Tonmoy islam pic-2.png" to the frontend as a static asset and render it as an additional medium-size portrait on every page (Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Contact), positioned in the top-right corner inside each page’s main section/container (not fixed globally), while keeping the existing images already shown on the site.

Republish the site so the old published link is replaced entirely and the live site is accessible under the domain identifier exactly: "sheik-tonmoy-islam" (must meet the 5–50 characters rule and use only letters, numbers, and hyphens).
Fix the production image loading issue so the uploaded photo "Tonmoy islam pic.png" reliably renders on the published site (no broken/missing image) wherever it is used.

Update all pages so the small top-right corner portraits are completely removed and replaced with a single larger right-side portrait using "Tonmoy islam pic.png" on every page (Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Contact). This larger portrait should be the only decorative right-side portrait element on each page.
Rebuild and republish the site so the fixed images and updated portrait placement are live under the existing domain identifier "sheik-tonmoy-islam".

Remove all pictures/images from the website UI so that no elements render anywhere (including portraits, logos, and decorative background images), and ensure the layout remains visually clean using only CSS gradients/shapes/text.

Remove or disable all portrait-related components/usages so they are not imported/rendered anywhere (including RightSidePortrait, ProfilePortrait usages if any, and legacy SectionCornerPortrait/SectionMediumPortrait if referenced).
Republish the site so the updated no-images version is live under the existing production identifier exactly: "sheik-tonmoy-islam".
Re-enable image rendering on the website and add the previously uploaded bio picture file "Tonmoy islam pic.png" back into the UI as a portrait.

Place the bio picture "Tonmoy islam pic.png" in the About page as a clearly visible biography portrait (near the About header and bio content) while keeping the existing layout responsive and visually clean.
Rebuild and republish the site so the updated version (with the bio picture restored) is live under the existing production identifier exactly: "sheik-tonmoy-islam".

Implement a full-page, animated video-style “3D waterfall” background that is visible across every route/page (Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Contact) and replaces the existing blue-gradient page background theme.
Add the waterfall background as static frontend assets and integrate it in a production-safe way (autoplay, muted, loop) with accessibility/performance fallbacks.
Remove or refactor existing gradient-background wrappers so they do not conflict with the new waterfall background, while preserving component structure and responsive spacing.
Rebuild and republish the updated site (waterfall background theme) to production under the existing identifier exactly "sheik-tonmoy-islam" and ensure the live URL loads correctly.

Generate a new static waterfall background image and add it to the frontend as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, suitable for full-screen background use (high-resolution, photorealistic waterfall scene).

Replace the current animated 3D waterfall video background implementation with a static background image implementation that applies across every route/page (Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Contact) via the global layout (`frontend/src/components/layout/SiteLayout.tsx`).

Update styling so the static waterfall background has an always-on readability overlay (scrim) equivalent to the current waterfall overlay, and ensure the overlay/background do not block interactions (pointer-events disabled) and remain behind all page content.

Remove or disable any now-unused waterfall video asset references in code paths (e.g., `WaterfallVideoBackground` sources/poster usage) so production builds do not depend on video files for the background rendering.
Rebuild and republish the updated site so the static waterfall image background version is live under the existing production identifier exactly: `sheik-tonmoy-islam`.

Make typography across the entire site (all pages/routes) more readable over the static waterfall background by applying a stronger text color and a strong, high-contrast text shadow globally, with headings and body text using the same visibility style.

Adjust global theme tokens/styles so commonly used secondary text (e.g., elements using muted/secondary foreground styles) also remains readable over the waterfall background while preserving the existing design language.
Rebuild and republish the site so the typography readability improvements are live under the existing production identifier exactly: "sheik-tonmoy-islam".

Update the site-wide typography visibility styling so headings and body text use the same more-saturated text color and a lighter/subtler (lower-contrast) text-shadow compared to the current strong, high-contrast shadow, across all routes/pages.
Ensure the About page typography is clearly visible and looks good using the same global typography visibility styling (no special-case styling unique to the About page).

Remove the global site-wide typography text-shadow so that headings and body text render with no text-shadow across all routes/pages (Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Contact) for clearer readability over the waterfall background.
